resources.string: Cannot reach server. Please check your internet connection.

Pit Stops time is measured from season 2011 onwards. 
The FIA releases only the total pit lane time. At the moment of developing this application, there was no data for the tire change. Therefore I refer to the pit lane time as a pit stop. Usually, the data will be available 2 - 6 hours after the race. 
The time difference is calculated according to this formula: difference = (driver1 pit stop time) - (driver2 pit stop time) 
From 2015 cars proceed to the pit lane instead of staying on the grid in the event of a red flag, this will also be shown as a pit stop. 
Many thanks to Ergast API for providing the data

 Developed by Pawel Sznura

The FIA releases only the total pit lane time. At the moment of developing this application, there was no data for the tire change. Therefore I refer to the pit lane time as a pit stop.

The time difference is calculated according to this formula: difference = (driver1 pit stop time) - (driver2 pit stop time)
From 2015 cars proceed to the pit lane instead of staying on the grid in the event of a red flag, this will also be shown as a pit stop.
